info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 21 at 1:02AM CDT until July 21 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT FOR EASTERN TEXAS AND NORTHEASTERN HANSFORD COUNTIES... At 102 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles southeast of Hardesty, or 20 miles northwest of Perryton, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect some tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Guymon, Hooker, Optima, Hardesty and Adams. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
